result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Alessi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to costs.  Any remaining costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Jeanne J.  
Court requires WCS reporting for another 30 days.  
Court allows the defendant to go out of state out 10/10/2015 and 10/11/2015.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: scanned and destroyed
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Jacob A Alessi in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant moves to have this matter adjourned until after his 1 year probation on October 2, 2016.  Court orders the defendant provide a DNA Sample.  Defendant refuses to submit the DNA sample.  Court requires the defendant to provide a DNA sample by the end of the day today.  A Waukesha County Sheriff Deputy will escort the defendant to get the DNA Sample taken.
Hearing on September 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Received August 17, 2016, from Jacob Alessi, regarding DNA sample (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on August 19, 2016, set for hearing)
dated Nov 27, 2015 from WCS Day Report Center
dated Oct 5, 2015 from WCS, updating the court on reporting
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Sentencing hearing at 10-02-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Jacob A Alessi in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wishes to pleah on this case.  Court steps down so the defendant can review paperwork.  Case recalled at 9:37 am.  Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  State gives recommendations.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sets this case for sentencing so the State can notify the victim in case # 15CM296. 


  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
